data=load('..\TP3\Solution\Data\datag.dat');
%data=load('Data\datag.dat');

%binNb = int64((1/150) * size(data, 1))
%h=histogram(data, binNb);
h=histogram(data, 40);
y=h.Values;
CentresBins=(h.BinEdges(2:end)+h.BinEdges(1:end-1))/2;
cla
hold on
plot(CentresBins,y)

parameters=nlinfit(CentresBins,y,@FamGauss,[max(y) mean(y) std(y)])

x2=[min(CentresBins):0.01:max(CentresBins)];
y2=FamGauss(parameters,x2);
plot(x2,y2,'k')

%the Gaussian seems to be a resonably fit for the data.
%when we change the number of bins we observe that the mean and standard deviation
%stay the same, but the amplitude changes. (roughly inversely to the amount of bins)
%if the amount of bins is too small (e.g. 10) or too high (e.g. 100) the fit
%is also not so good.

function y=FamGauss(a,x)
    y=a(1)*exp(- (x-a(2)).^2/(a(3)^2));
end

parameters =
  462.3665   80.9703   -4.5254
